=== (*) Notes and recipes ===

==== Graphic acceleration ====
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 8.10 (Intrepid Ibex): Running "glxinfo | grep direct" returns "direct rendering: Yes", but graphics are too slow. Is there any command that trusts if 3D acceleration works?

==== Wireless NIC ====
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 6.06 (Dapper Drake): It worked with a script I found on the Internet.
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 7.04 (Feisty Fawn): It worked with the package of the firmware, but stopped working. Reinstalling OS din't solve the problem.
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 7.10 (Gutsy Gibbon): Using restricted manager works, but very bad.
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 8.10 (Intrepid Ibex): Restricted manager offers the bcm43xx driver, but enabling it doesn't find any network. May work with <nowiki>[[http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=766560|this guide for using ndiswrapper on Broadcom]]</nowiki>
